metadata.Title: CVE-2017-15420 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect handling of back navigations in error pages in Navigation in Google Chrome prior to 63.0.3239.84 allowed a remote attacker to spoof the contents of the Omnibox (URL bar) via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-15420` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '63.0.3239.84-0ubuntu1').
